nodes.bodyText: It is either an IForgeRegistry<CitizenDataTypeRegirtryEntry> or the method should be called getCitizenDataRegistry()
See interface declaration on naming issues.

If I see this correctly, this would allow for a custom ICitizenData implementation to be used.
I do not think this is a good idea.
A better approach to solve this problem would be to make ICitizenData an ICapabilityProvider and via this way allow the handling and adaptation of custom data on a given citizen.
Since i also see no real reason why this is part of this PR, it should be split of into a seperate one.
Additionally I see no reason for it to exist at all..... So there is that, but i might be missing something.

The idea for this was to have a central place for varying external citizen entities, which can be traders/visitor citizens/guards whatever and still get the sync benefit colonyviews serialization/deserialization.
Your warning references the wrong class name: Should be: ModCitizenDataTypeInitializer?

Remove this class from this PR.
As stated it is not needed, can be added later again, but for now please do not mix feature and infrastructure or bugfixes in one PR but split them in several.
Mixing the goals of a PR makes things harder.

This needs to be way more dynamic.
I already told ray this.
Please find a way to make this more fluently useable.
Instead of doing a bunch of if switches design a registry or even a better placement logic system todo this.
I think this would be too out of scope of this PR, I here just move the existing logic a bit
There are a lot of things in this PR that are completely out of scope...... Hence this PR needs to be broken up into several pieces.
I wouldnt label 1 and an unused thing as a lot of things xD
1 and an unused thing is still 2 more then should be in this PR.
